results.title: If you are not part of the solution...you are part of the problem
results.creator_credit: Center for Digital Storytelling US, ACMI and Libby Lloyd
results.brief_description: Violence against women is possibly the most important, least examined and most taboo subject in our society. This film explores the beginnings of White Ribbon Day and the campaign to making it an important high profile public awareness day in Australia.

results.title: If you're a horse
results.creator_credit: William Van Horn, Paul B. Foster, Davidson Films and Xerox Publication Films
results.brief_description: Part of the “Human values series”. This episode shows what happens when a horse that loves to eat apples meets an ogre that loves to eat horses. Encourages examination of the idea of temptation in human values. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: If We Don't, Remember Me
results.brief_description:
IWDRM was a blog of animated movie stills active from 2010 to 2015.

A video installation was shown in exhibitions at the Contemporary Arts Museum (Houston, TX), &FOAM (Amsterdam) and The Event (Birmingham).

constellations_other.name: Magic lanterns and internet culture

results.title: If we don't go, we'll never know, will we?
results.creator_credit: Russell Toose, Constance Bernstein and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chequerboard”.
The Gordons, with their four children, are migrating from England to australia. This film interviews the Gordons in England and hears of their hopes and dreams. It then spends the first six months in Australia with the family to find out the reality. Reporters: Richard Oxenburgh, Robert Higson.
results.title_for_label: If we don’t go, we’ll never know, will we?

results.title: If war should come
results.brief_description: Part of the “History through the newsreel: the 1930s” series which presents extracts from newreels which were shown to the British public during the years 1937 to 1939. Covers Britain’s rearmament plans (1937); Guernica’s collapse in air raids during the Spanish Civil War; Tsingtao falling to the Japanese; the opening of a British Military Base in Singapore; the building of the French Maginot Line; the development of bomb proof shelter; air raid precaution techniques in Australia and England; the development of the Spitfire; the introduction of conscription in April 1939; a civil defence recruiting trailer; and the evacuation of children from Britain’s large cities. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: If trees can fly
results.brief_description: A visual essay on the random thoughts of two 10-year old children as they witness nature unfolding - bird eggs hatching, swans preening themselves and birds in flight. Through the fantasies they create, they relate how they think about birth, death and life.
results.description: A visual essay on the random thoughts of two 10-year old children as they witness nature unfolding - bird eggs hatching, swans preening themselves and birds in flight. Through the fantasies they create, they relate how they think about birth, death and life.
